skill.name: content-strategy
skill.description: When the user wants to plan a content strategy, decide what content to create, or figure out what topics to cover. Also use when the user mentions "content strategy," "what should I write about," "content ideas," "blog strategy," "topic clusters," or "content planning." For writing individual pieces, see copywriting. For SEO-specific audits, see seo-audit.
skill.summary: Plan content strategies, decide what to create, and figure out topics to cover
skill.author: coreyhaines31

content.value_statement: Marketing teams struggle to consistently produce content that resonates with their audience. This skill helps plan strategic content that aligns with business goals and audience needs using proven frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Develop content strategies aligned with business objectives
Identify topic clusters and content pillars for SEO
Create content calendars with editorial timelines
Research audience pain points and content gaps
Define content success metrics and KPIs
limitations: Does not write actual content pieces (see copywriting skill)
Cannot access real-time search volume or competition data
Does not audit existing content for SEO (see seo-audit skill)
Cannot publish or distribute content automatically

use_cases.title: New content initiative launch
use_cases.description: Planning a blog or content marketing program from scratch with topics, formats, and publishing schedule.

use_cases.title: Content gap analysis
use_cases.description: Identifying topics the brand should cover based on audience questions and competitor analysis.

use_cases.title: Editorial planning
use_cases.description: Creating a quarterly content calendar with themes, formats, and production timeline.

prompt_templates.title: Basic content planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan a content strategy for my [industry/niche] business. We want to reach [target audience] and achieve [business goal]. What topics should we cover and in what format?
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new content initiative with defined audience and goals

prompt_templates.title: Topic cluster development
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a topic cluster strategy for the main topic of [core topic]. Include the pillar page, supporting subtopics, and how they should link together for SEO.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building topical authority around a key subject area

prompt_templates.title: Content calendar creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 3-month content calendar for [season/campaign]. We can produce [number] pieces per week in formats like [formats]. Include themes, topics, and publishing dates.
prompt_templates.scenario: Planning content production for a specific time period

prompt_templates.title: Audience-driven content map
prompt_templates.prompt: Map out a content plan based on the customer journey. What content should we create for awareness, consideration, and decision stages for [product/service]?
prompt_templates.scenario: Aligning content with sales funnel stages

output_examples.input: Help me plan a content strategy for a SaaS startup targeting small business owners who need accounting software.
output: **Content Strategy Summary**: Small business accounting education hub
**Core Themes**: Bookkeeping basics, Tax preparation, Cash flow management, Financial reporting
- Subtopics: Recording transactions, Reconciliation, Chart of accounts
**Content Formats**: How-to guides (60%), Case studies (25%), Checklists (15%)
**Publishing Cadence**: 2 posts per week for first 3 months

output_examples.input: Create a topic cluster around remote team management.
output: **Pillar Page**: The Complete Guide to Remote Team Management
**Internal Linking Strategy**: Each subtopic links to pillar and related subtopics

best_practices: Start with audience research before planning topics - understand their questions and pain points first
Build content around topic clusters to establish topical authority for SEO
Align content formats with audience preferences and sales funnel stage
Plan content in advance but stay flexible for timely opportunities
anti_patterns: Creating content without clear business objectives or audience benefit
Focusing only on high-volume keywords without considering search intent
Planning content without considering production capacity and resources
Ignoring content repurposing and using each piece only once

faq.question: What is the difference between content strategy and copywriting?
faq.answer: Content strategy is the planning phase - deciding what topics to cover, in what format, and on what timeline. Copywriting is the execution phase - actually writing the content. Use content-strategy for planning, copywriting for drafting.

faq.question: How often should I update my content strategy?
faq.answer: Review your strategy quarterly and update annually. Quarterly reviews allow for seasonal adjustments and response to performance data. Annual reviews ensure alignment with changing business goals.

faq.question: How many topics should I start with?
faq.answer: Start with 3 to 5 core topic clusters and expand from there. This creates focus and allows you to build depth before spreading too thin. Quality over quantity leads to better SEO results.

faq.question: Does this skill help with SEO keyword research?
faq.answer: This skill helps plan content around SEO principles like topic clusters and search intent. For specific keyword data like search volume and competition, use dedicated SEO tools or research methods.

faq.question: How do I measure content strategy success?
faq.answer: Track metrics like organic traffic growth, keyword rankings, content production against plan, engagement rates, and conversion paths. Set KPIs at the start and review monthly.

faq.question: Can I use this for social media content planning?
faq.answer: Yes. The same principles of audience research, topic planning, and editorial calendars apply to social media. Specify that you want social formats when providing context.
